channel.title: Turbofish on Tek Shinobi Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Turbofish on Tek Shinobi Blog

item.title: Turbofish in Rust
item.description: Consider the following code (or run it in rust playground here): fn main() { let a:Vec = vec![1, 2, 3]; let doubled = a.iter().map(|&x| x * 2).collect(); assert_eq!(vec![2, 4, 6], doubled); } If you ran it in the playground linked above, you will see the following compiler error. error[E0282]: type annotations needed --> src/main.rs:4:9 | 4 | let doubled = a.iter().map(|&x| x * 2).collect(); | ^^^^^^^ consider giving `doubled` a type error: aborting due to previous error For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0282`.
